greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least Carmichael number that is divisible by the n-th cyclic number A003277(n).
comment: Has any odd cyclic number at least one Carmichael multiple?
link: Tim Johannes Ohrtmann and Max Alekseyev, Table of n, a(n) for n = 3..853
Gérard P. Michon, Carmichael Multiples of Odd Cyclic Numbers
example: a(8) = 62745 because this is the least Carmichael number which is divisible by 15 (the 8th cyclic number).
program: a(n) = {on = odd cyclic number(n); cn = 1; until (isA002997(cn) && (cn % on == 0), cn++); cn; }
results.author: _Tim Johannes Ohrtmann_, Jan 05 2015
